Nutrition and pregnancy refers to the nutrient intake, 
and dietary planning that is undertaken before, during 
and after pregnancy. In a precursory study into the 
link      nutrition and pregnancy in 1950 women who consumed minimal amounts over the eight-week period had a higher mortality or 
disorder rate concerning their offspring than women 
who ate regularly, attributed to the fact that the children born to well-fed mothers had less
